ygData.subject: Re: Carnage
ygData.msgSnippet: Teltoli faltered for a second, crossing both arms tightly across her chest as she looked down at the hole that Carnage was digging. It was something to focus

Teltoli faltered for a second, crossing both arms tightly across her 
chest as she looked down at the hole that Carnage was digging. It was 
something to focus on, at least.

But she wanted to know how the real warriors live, and maybe even one 
day.. become one of them. The Fuzor doubted she ever would. When she 
was little she fainted at the sight of mech-fluid. Okay, she could 
stand it now, but it didn't mean that she was much better.

"Yes I'm sure! All my life I've been called a child, and thought of 
one, and even my friends assumed that I needed protecting even when I 
could've fended for myself! For once in my life, I want to be viewed 
as something other than a little kid who can't stand up to school 
bullies!"

With a start she realized she was suddenly on the other side of 
Carnage, and remembered that she had been pacing while ranting half 
to herself, but loud enough for her friend to hear.

"I don't care what the cost is. I don't care if it half-kills me for 
crying out loud! I want the knowledge that I can stand up for myself 
without half my friends getting hurt trying to protect me!"
